intro: Erigeron eruptens, commonly known as the showy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron eruptens is known for its ornamental value and is often used in native plant gardens.
